presenting_complaint: I don't feel well, I have a cough and runny nose
note:
4/7 hx of generally unwell, mainly sore throat, runny nose, fatigue, myalgia and general joint pain. Sore throat is improving. Also has nasal congestion. Now developed a cough -mainly dry, constant. Night sweats for the past 4/7. Initially had fever, but now settling with paracetamol/ibuprofen. 
No chest pain. Feels more SOB on exertion. 
Associated headaches - generalized, intermittent. No visual sx/photophobia. No nausea/vomiting. No bowel or urinary sx. Drinking fluids, reduced appetite. No rashes

PMH: Nil 
DH: nil 
NKDA
FH: Grandmother - type 2 diabetes
SH: lives alone, works as an accountant. Occasional smoker/etOH. Finding work slightly stressful. No mood sx. 

Imp: viral URTI/influenza 

Plan:
1.	Conservative mx - rest, push fluids, regular paracetamol/ibuprofen, monitor temp
2.	Review in 5-7d INB
3.	Discussed red flag sx (SOB, chest pain, fevers)- if present, for urgent review with Dr

1 day hx of SOB, slight pleuritic pain (right side), feeling warm (not measured temperature), 2 episodes haemoptysis and palpitations.
No recent long haul flights
No FH or PMHx of DVT/Pes
Has been feeling TATT/ fatigue for the last few weeks preceding these symptoms

DH: on methotrexate
No allergies
SH lives alone, has cat, works in an office
Ex: pulse around 66, normal CRT, throat inspection normal, pt cant feel any LNs in neck, not SOB, looks well
Imp: probable LRTI, possibly secondary to immunosuppression
Plan: needs F2f gp assessment today to listen to chest and check BP/pulse/ temp
May also need blood tests to check immune status in view of methotrexate

PC: Abdominal pain. HPC: Periumbilical pain, constant getting worse. Severity 8/10. Has had some light PV bleeding. No dysuria/frequency but some difficulty PUing. BO daily, normal stool. Constipation for a week last week. LMP 2 weeks ago. No other PV discharge. E&D ok. Not checked temp. Does not feel feverish. Not feeling faint. No DIB/shoulder tip pain. Nausea. No vomiting/diarrhoea. Last foreign travel 1 yr ago. 
Implanon 1 yr ago. 
PMH: Nil significant
DH: Nil. Allergic to amoxicillin
SH; Teacher, has been able to work as usual. Lives with parents. No smoker/alcohol/drugs.
Imp: Abdominal pain ? cause. Needs to check preg test today and contact us immediately if pos. Urgent examination booked with Dr. To get in touch before if pain worse/new sx.

No chest pain. No nausea,no vomiting, no problems e+d
SOB worse at night
Now having problems speaking in full sentences

Having to use the blue inhalers twice a day
